name: SkyDrift

reviews.review_text: What a surprise! This is an extremely fun arcade racer with boost, powerups and unlockable stuff. The graphics are beautiful, the landscape is stunning, the entire game is fantastic! This game is similar to BLUR, but with airplanes. Don't worry, it's not easy at all, it's challenging even at the first few maps! This game is underrated and overlooked by any means. WORTH IT! The only flaw however: no split-screen 2 player mode.
Super fun fast paced racing game! I love airplanes! 9/10

The only problem is that on the last Levels the game is too hard. Medium difficult looks like Impossible (I still can't beat the last race in 1st place - got 2nd only), the AI is a pain. Overall it is a good game, kinda short and the replay vallue is good. Too bad the community is dead, cause I can't complete the online achievements.

SkyDrift is a fun, slightly non-serious racing/combat game. Unlike most racing titles, where you drive cars, here you're flying airplanes of varying types.   The first thing I noted was the graphics, which in my opinion, were fantastic. Admittedly, it's sometimes difficult to notice detail when you're flying at high speeds through caverns, dodging enemy fire and launching missiles their way in return. Regardless, the visuals are impressive.  The audio is decent. Nothing to complain about, but nothing to rave about either. The music is good and the sound effects work nicely. My one gripe (and it's a minor one) is the announcer, whose voice is a bit annoying. Then again, I generally dislike announcers in any game, so take my opinion with a grain of salt.  The controls are tight and responsive with a gamepad, which is something you'll want. The keyboard works well too, but there are times you'll wish you had an analogue stick. I don't know if flight sticks are supported.  The single player part of the game has practice runs, time trials, and real races. The multiplayer component is supposedly similar. I wouldn't know since I haven't tried it. I imagine that, like any racing game, lag can have a huge impact on racing performance.   One last thing I'd like to comment on is the design of the planes you fly. They're often odd and sometimes outlandish. I like that, given the fact the game isn't supposed to be realistic. It also reminds me of an old PC game entitled Crimson Skies, which handled similarly, although the game's content was much different.  All in all, I'd recommend SkyDrift if you like racing games (with combat) and you're ltired of driving cars. Just don't mistake this game for a serious simulation, as it's most definitely arcade action all the way.

This game is crazy fun and addictive. The planes are well balanced and the graphics are very good. My only complaint about the game is that you need to compete in multiplayer matches to unlock certain paint schemes and one airplane - and the multiplayer community is essentially dead. For $3 i'm not complaining too loudly, but I sure would like a way to experience the last aircraft.
I'm not sure how well this game sold, but I have a feeling the answer is not enough. Super fun game and the 'speed races' are thrilling.

While I've never been the greatest fan of the racing genre, I still enjoy the concept and get an occasional amount of fun out of them. This game is something different though...you race with planes. And not only that, but the controls are so tight, you'd swear every time you played it was your first time.  Seriously though, if you love racers with tight controls, genuinely challenging AI to battle when not with friends and a bounty of pick-ups to choose from and use against opponents, then this is the racing game for you!  Oh yeah, friends. Have I not mentioned yet that this game is multiplayer? Cause it is. It's well worth it for even the default price of £6.99 and its a heck of alot of fun.

Skydrift is an absolutely fantastic game with some very unfortunate issues dragging it down. The racing and combat are absolutely top-notch but a dearth of tracks, inexplicably dead online multiplayer, and an absence of offline multiplayer really hurt the overall package.  That said, at ten dollars what's here is extremely polished. Just be sure to bring a gamepad (and maybe buy a few copies for your online friends.)

SkyDrift is one of the best racing games I've ever had the change to play. It reminds me of a more fleshed out version of the flying races in Diddy Kong Racing 64. My only real complaint is the lack of race tracks. There is only 5, all of which have can be reversed (to make 10). If there were more tracks this game would have much more play value. I feel the multiplayer is where this game would stride, but with a small community it can be frustrating to find people to play with. Over all this game is definitely worth the $10.

This game is truly a hidden gem, One of the best titles in racing. The game is easy to pick up while playing, controls are spot on, the graphics are delicious andd the overalll experience is worth 5 times over your purchase price. I would recommend this game to anybody, it is a heck lot of fun and it is truly a fantastic game and deserves to be in anybody's game library!
